gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਾਪ ਕੋ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪ ਅੈਸੋ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਕੈ ਪਰਸਪਰ ਪਗ ਲਪਟਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Gursikh Sangati Milaap Ko Prataap Aiso , Praym Kai Parasapar Pag Lapataavahee ?
translation: The glory of the meeting of obedient and truthful persons of the True Guru is such that they bend down to touch each others feet regardless of their high or low status or age.

gurmukhi: ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਦਰਸ ਅਰੁ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Drisati Daras Aru Sabad Surati Mili , Pooran Braham Giaan Dhiaan Liv Laavahee ?
translation: Having seen the True Guru and by the divine effect of words residing in their mind, such Sikhs of the Guru remain engrossed in perfect Lord by virtue of Guru's knowledge and contemplation. The effect is always visible on them.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਮਿਸਟਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਲਾਵਤ ਮਹਾ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ੲੇਕ ਗੁਰਪੁਰਬ ਕੈ ਸਿਖਨੁ ਬੁਲਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Ayk Misataan Paan Laavat Mahaa Prasaadi , Ayk Gurpurab Kai Sikhanu Bulaavahee ?
translation: Many of these devotees of the Guru bring dainty dishes for the consumption of the saintly persons of the congregation. Others send invitations to the Sikhs of Guru and hold Religious functions on the days associated with their Gurus.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਨਕਾਦਿ ਬਾਛੈ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ੳੁਚਿਸਟ ਕੳੁ ਸਾਧਨ ਕੀ ਦੂਖਨਾ ਕਵਨ ਫਲ ਪਾਵਹੀ ॥੩੦੯॥
transliteration: Siv Sanakaadi Baachhai Tin Kay Ouchisat Kau , Saadhan Kee Dookhanaa Kavan Dhal Paavahee ?309?
translation: Even gods like Shiv, Sanak crave for the leftovers of such Sikhs of the Guru who are blessed with divine traits of Naam Simran. What good will one reap who thinks ill of such godly ones? It is evident that such a person will be severely 'shed in the court
